identificationModule.officialTitle: Post Stroke Intensive Rehabilitation: Predictors of Outcome and Response to Specific Interventions

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Prospective observational cohort study, with 6 months follow up, to identify clinical, instrumental and genetic predictors of functional recovery in hospitalized patients undergoing intensive rehabilitation after stroke. All patients will be evaluated with a standardized protocol. Functional recovery will be assessed at the discharge and after a period of 6 months.

bioSpec.description: A subgroup of those patients belonging to the IRCCS of Florence (stimate 90), after signing the informed consent, will offer a blood sample for genetic testing of Brain-Derived Neurotrophic Factor (BDNF) polymorphisms at admission (Time 0) and a blood sample for the study of epigenetic modifications of BDNF at the outpatient follow-up after 6 months (Time 2).

armGroups.label: 1 study group
armGroups.description: All patients hospitalized in 4 intensive rehabilitation Structures of Don Gnocchi Foundation during the enrollment period, suffering from acute (within 30 days) ischemic or emorragic stroke

primaryOutcomes.description: Functional recovery; Score from 0 to 100; higher values represent a better outcome.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Admission: Time 0; Discharge, up to 3/4 weeks: Time 1; 6-months Follow up: Time 2

secondaryOutcomes.description: Functional recovery; Score from 0 to 6; higher values represent a worse outcome.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Admission: Time 0; Discharge,up to 3/4 weeks: Time 1; 6-months Follow up: Time 2

secondaryOutcomes.description: Sensomotor recovery; Total score from 0 to 64, Upper-limb subscale 0-36; lower-limb subscale 0-28. Higher values represent a better outcome.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Admission: Time 0; Discharge,up to 3/4 weeks: Time 1; 6-months Follow up: Time 2

secondaryOutcomes.measure: change in communication ability (Scala di disabilit√† comunicativa -SDC)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Communication recovery; Score from 0 to 4; higher values represent a better outcome.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Admission: Time 0; Discharge, up to 3/4 weeks: Time 1; 6-months Follow up: Time 2

secondaryOutcomes.description: The Oxford Cognitive Screen (OCS) describes the cognitive deficits after stroke.The scale consists of 10 tasks encompassing five cognitive domains: attention and executive function, language, memory, number processing, and praxis.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Admission: Time 0; Discharge, up to 3/4 weeks: Time 1; 6-months Follow up: Time 2

secondaryOutcomes.measure: change in Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS)
secondaryOutcomes.description: depression and anxiety; Score from 0 to 21, subitems Depression and Anxiety. Higher values represent a worse outcome.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Admission: Time 0; Discharge, up to 3/4 weeks: Time 1; 6-months Follow up: Time 2

secondaryOutcomes.description: Walking recovery; Score from 0 to 5. Higher values represent a better outcome.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Admission: Time 0; Discharge, up to 3/4 weeks: Time 1; 6-months Follow up: Time 2

secondaryOutcomes.description: Trunk control recovery; Score from 0 to 100;Higher values represent a better outcome.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Admission: Time 0; Discharge, up to 3/4 weeks: Time 1; 6-months Follow up: Time 2

secondaryOutcomes.description: Pain assessment; Score from 0 to 10; Higher values represent a worse outcome.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Admission: Time 0; Discharge, up to 3/4 weeks: Time 1; 6-months Follow up: Time 2

secondaryOutcomes.description: Spasticity; Score from 0 to 4; Higher values represent a worse outcome.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Admission: Time 0; Discharge, up to 3/4 weeks: Time 1; 6-months Follow up: Time 2

secondaryOutcomes.measure: change in National Institute of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS)
secondaryOutcomes.description: clinical recovery; 15 items scored from 3 to 4 ( total score from 0 to 42). Higher values represent a worse outcome.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Admission: Time 0; Discharge, up to 3/4 weeks: Time 1; 6-months Follow up: Time 2

secondaryOutcomes.description: We will report possible post stroke seizures.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Admission: Time 0; Discharge, up to 3/4 weeks: Time 1; 6-months Follow up: Time 2

secondaryOutcomes.measure: change in serum Brain Derived Neurotrophic factor (BDNF) epigenetic profile
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Admission: Time 0; Discharge, up to 3/4 weeks: Time 1; 6-months Follow up: Time 2

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion criteria:

* age 18-90
* acute ischemic or hemorrhagic stroke (within 30 days)
* consent to participate and to anonymous processing of data.

Additional inclusion criteria for Sub-project Neurophysiological Markers:

-signing of informed consent for the participation in the sub-project.

Additional inclusion criteria for Epigenetic subproject:

-signing of informed consent for participation in the subproject.

Exclusion Criteria:

-Stroke occurred more than 30 days after the transfer to intensive rehabilitation

Additional exclusion criteria for Epigenetic subproject (for retrospective analysis):

* history of major psychiatric disorder or recent exacerbation
* global aphasia
* refusal of the patient to participate in the study.
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Consecutively recruited all patients hospitalized in 4 intensive rehabilitative Structures of Don Gnocchi Foundation (IRCCS Firenze, Massa, Fivizzano, La Spezia). Is estimated to recruit a sample of 270 patients (approximately 90 in Florence, 90 in Spezia and 90 in Massa and Fivizzano). Sampling will be performed on presentation, including in the study all the subjects that meet the inclusion criteria listed above. For the sub-project Markers Neurophysiological it is planned to recruit all the patients involved in the general project related to Florence and La Spezia (estimate: 180). For the epigenetic subproject we estimate to involve all the patients recruited in the general project related to Florence (estimate: 90).
